TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void NetworkAvailableEventHandler(object sender, NetworkAvailableEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed NetworkAvailableEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub NetworkAvailableEventHandler(sender As Object, e As NetworkAvailableEventArgs)
public delegate void NetworkAvailableEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, NetworkAvailableEventArgs ^ e);
type NetworkAvailableEventHandler = delegate of obj * NetworkAvailableEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the or event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In Visual Basic, you do not need to work with this delegate explicitly. For more information, see the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> event or the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Devices.Network.NetworkAvailabilityChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> event.
